definitions.definition: Any word or phrase that expresses (that the speaker, writer, or signer has) a certain attitude toward or information about the referent.

A word or phrase, belonging to a distinct word class or having distinct morphosyntactic properties, with semantic symbolism (for example, an onomatopoeia ), variously considered either a synonym, a hypernym or a hyponym of ideophone .

main_definition: ( linguistics ) Any word or phrase that expresses (that the speaker, writer, or signer has) a certain attitude toward or information about the referent.
secondary_definitions: ( linguistics , more narrowly ) A word or phrase, belonging to a distinct word class or having distinct morphosyntactic properties, with semantic symbolism (for example, an onomatopoeia ), variously considered either a synonym, a hypernym or a hyponym of ideophone .
